messages.message:
Hi, I have some strange behaviour when using clean and validate.
Steps
1. I added a clean function to add a leading 0 to company__number
2. I added a validation function to print out the company__number

I noticed a usability problem:
• If I add a clean function and without saving, add a validation function, the validation function uses the non-cleaned value. This may be confusing as it shows as cleaned on the platform but the non-clean value is being used. Is there an argument here of an alert that forces users to either save before making new functions or barr it entirely?

And a bug:
• I intended to show the above behaviour, but as i exited both functions, saved, refreshed the page, and entered the validation function, it now cannot find the company__number value `TypeError: unnamed_custom_function() missing 1 required positional argument: 'company__number'` - even though the function has a field called this
• Making any edit in the function (like adding a new line) seems to unblock this behavior
https://www.loom.com/share/e1cb36e077224e168d453c4f372b79ec?sid=c8456551-12c9-4e75-8c6f-79471f5bdd45
I also experienced the error: `unnamed_custom_function() missing 1 required positional argument: 'company__number'`  a few weeks ago but wasn't able to recreate
cc @danny.lan for the udf error. The first issue is because validations unfortunately only works on saved field changes. This should be solved soon as the team is working on auto-saving changes
